div.p: Per Governor Tony Evers orders on April 16th, all private and public schools will be closed for the remainder of the 2019-20 school year.

ul.li: March 16-until June 9: All athletic events and practices cancelled or suspended
March 16-until June 9: Majority of activities and programs cancelled or suspended. Details will be communicated at a later date by the Marinette School District for individual events.
June 15-July 14: Summer Learning Program dates, times, potential changes and details will be announced at a later date.

a.title: FREE LUNCH & BREAKFAST PROGRAM
a.div: FOR ALL OF OUR FAMILIES! Please remember to take advantage of the free bag lunch and breakfast. The details are linked here--just click on this box.

span.data-emptytext: Marinette School District provides equal opportunity in its programs, activities, and employment
span.data-value:
Website Accessibility Disclaimer The School District of Marinette is committed to providing information on our website that is available to as many people as possible. We strive to meet the requirements of the Disability Discrimination Act, Section 504 of the Rehabilitations Act of 1973, and Title II of the Americans with Disabilities Act of 1990. We will make every effort to ensure that our communications are accessible to those with special needs, including individuals with visual, hearing, cognitive, and motor impairments.
While the School District of Marinette attempts to adhere to the accepted guidelines and standards for accessibility and usability, it is not always possible to do so in all areas of the website. We are continually seeking out solutions that will bring all areas of the site up to the same level of overall web accessibility.
If you are having a problem with accessing any of the information on our website due to a disability, please contact our Webmaster at webmaster@marinette.k12.wi.us

p.span:
Website Accessibility Disclaimer The School District of Marinette is committed to providing information on our website that is available to as many people as possible. We strive to meet the requirements of the Disability Discrimination Act, Section 504 of the Rehabilitations Act of 1973, and Title II of the Americans with Disabilities Act of 1990. We will make every effort to ensure that our communications are accessible to those with special needs, including individuals with visual, hearing, cognitive, and motor impairments.
While the School District of Marinette attempts to adhere to the accepted guidelines and standards for accessibility and usability, it is not always possible to do so in all areas of the website. We are continually seeking out solutions that will bring all areas of the site up to the same level of overall web accessibility.
If you are having a problem with accessing any of the information on our website due to a disability, please contact our Webmaster at webmaster@marinette.k12.wi.us

p.a: Website Hosting Solution Powered by SchoolBlocks

div.h3:
Welcome to the SchoolBlocks
self-guided tour!
div.p: The most common question we receive is, how is SchoolBlocks inspired by Pinterest? SchoolBlocks eliminates navigation bars and uses a block style layout that’s similar to Pinterest. It creates a unique and engaging browsing experience, optimizes for mobile and removes a lot of navigational complexity.
Please click on the red plus signs found on this page to learn more about specific features.
